TopicTitle: New headset what should i buy??

Articles.Content:
I am thinking of moving on to the next step and getting something better than the turtle beach X-12s. Im looking at the Logitech 930. Im looking for something under $150. I play alot of Gmod and KSP and a few other games. Im looking for something for the least amount of wires.

http://www.amazon.com/Logitech-Wireless-Gaming-Headset-Surround/dp/B003VANOFY/ref=lp_402053011_1_1?s=videogames&ie=UTF8&qid=1414504307&sr=1-1

What do you have and what should i get?

How about no headset at all? A dedicated mic & good earphones are way cheaper than a headset of the same quality since headsets are build for gamers who have money but dont know much about sound. BTW: I would use cablebased headphones since wireless are way more expensive for the same sound quality.
After reading more reviews and comments about the Logitech headset above im going to look for another type. I will go with wired. Its all about picking the right one.

I too prefer wired devices, batteries always seem to die at the most inconvenient times.. (also you will be less likely to misplace it if it's plugged in). I've been taking a look at some new headphones too, but I'm mostly looking at the low end (under 50$) so I don't really have any good recommendations. I'll keep an eye out though!
Get away from turtle beach. They break extremely easily. I'd recommend a pair of logitech G430s. Surround sound, completely over the ears, good design, good quality, and only one wire iirc.
